metadata.Title: CVE-2023-4052 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description: The Firefox updater created a directory writable by non-privileged users.When uninstalling Firefox, any files in that directory would be recursivelydeleted with the permissions of the uninstalling user account. This couldbe combined with creation of a junction (a form of symbolic link) to allowarbitrary file deletion controlled by the non-privileged user. *This bugonly affects Firefox on Windows. Other operating systems are unaffected.*This vulnerability affects Firefox < 116, Firefox ESR < 115.1, andThunderbird < 115.1.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mozjs38 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
